title: Game Pass API configuration schema
description: Validates configuration input for the Game Pass API script.

$schema.description: The JSON schema to use for the configuration file

market.description: The two letter market code for which to fetch games.

fetchConsole.description: Whether or not to fetch games available for console Game Pass.

fetchPC.description: Whether or not to fetch games available for PC Game Pass.

fetchEAPlay.description: Whether or not to fetch games available through EA Play.

includedProperties.description: The properties that should be contained in the cleaned version of the API response.

productTitle.description: Whether or not to include the title of the game.

developerName.description: Whether or not to include the name of the developer of the game.

publisherName.description: Whether or not to include the name of the publisher of the game.

enabled.description: Whether or not to include the description of the game.

preferShort.description: Whether or not to prefer the short description of the game, if one exists.

images.description: Whether or not to include image URL's for the game.

enabled.description: Whether or not to include any the images in the result.

maxImages.description: The maximum number of images to include. 0 or omission of this property means no limit is set and all matching images are returned.

imageTypes.description: What kinds of images should be considered. The order of types in the array defines which images are used first if "maxImages" is set to a value other than 0.

anyOf.title: Banner featuring the game's name. 16:9 aspect ratio. E.g. https://store-images.s-microsoft.com/image/apps.12688.68326442227858632.03782b23-7f26-4a8e-ba87-177bdf2c3c90.ef4d4f2f-1865-4fa7-8ec7-8b914cd4dcc0

Banner featuring the game's name in portrait mode, such as for smartphones. 2:3 aspect ratio. E.g. https://store-images.s-microsoft.com/image/apps.64810.68326442227858632.03782b23-7f26-4a8e-ba87-177bdf2c3c90.fdefe49f-270c-44e5-b660-6d7764b37f0f
Artwork without text. 16:9 aspect ratio. E.g. https://store-images.s-microsoft.com/image/apps.62159.68326442227858632.03782b23-7f26-4a8e-ba87-177bdf2c3c90.1405eb3a-6314-4e44-a822-7660d70a6ec5
Artwork without text. 2:1 aspect ratio. E.g. https://store-images.s-microsoft.com/image/apps.28129.13672427983916579.274b1ffd-9cde-4bef-9a3e-6f37073d5ed0.5eb8b4f3-3575-4d13-b0a4-b60d6c64f392

Banner featuring the game's logo and name in a square "box" format. 1:1 aspect ratio. E.g. https://store-images.s-microsoft.com/image/apps.4794.68326442227858632.03782b23-7f26-4a8e-ba87-177bdf2c3c90.b156af1e-9796-48af-8d11-3461727280ea

Banner featuring the game's name with a "XBOX" logo on top. 73:100 aspect ratio. E.g. https://store-images.s-microsoft.com/image/apps.27624.68326442227858632.21f49c7b-79d7-4647-b847-ecc7a34a7901.1aa31c66-2a52-45d6-8fed-badfb9f25ac6

Banner featuring the game's logo (without name) in a square "box" format. 1:1 aspect ratio. E.g. https://store-images.s-microsoft.com/image/apps.29819.68326442227858632.03782b23-7f26-4a8e-ba87-177bdf2c3c90.322d4aa6-0a23-4565-a64f-743f0620a96e

Small, square game logo, to be used e.g. as a game library icon. 1:1 aspect ratio. E.g. https://store-images.s-microsoft.com/image/apps.65119.13664397958929388.0e87ac81-8aa3-41f0-82dc-61a295fc5fe3.44bf032a-b113-4179-aa1b-f557dbcd3b19

releaseDate.description: Whether or not to include the game's release date.

enabled.description: Whether or not to include the game's release date.

format.description: How to format the date string. Either the full dateTime (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssssssZ) or just the date (YYYY-MM-DD).

userRating.description: Whether or not to include the game's user rating.

enabled.description: Whether or not to include the game's user rating.

format.description: How to format the rating. Either as a decimal (0.0 - 5.0) or as a percentage (0% - 100%).

outputIndexing.description: What kind of indexing the resulting JSON should use for the cleaned game properties.

oneOf.title: The game's title is used as the index.
The game's product Id is used as the index.
Standard integer indexing is used, starting at 0.
Standard integer indexing is used, starting at 1.
